oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Nashville City Cemetery historic marker, Nashville, Tennessee, 1978 May
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An historic marker for the Nashville City Cemetery located in Nashville, Tennessee, that reads: “First established in 1822, the remains of many early settlers were then brought here for permanent burial. Among the more than 20,000 persons buried here are Gen. James Robertson, Gov. William Carroll, Sec. of Treasury George W. Campbell, Lt. Gen. Richard S. Ewell, Brig. Gen. Felix K. Zollicoffer & Capt. William Driver.” Forms part of the Claynita Harris Slide Collection. The original is a 35 mm color transparency (2 x 2 in. slide mount)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Nashville City Cemetery
